intro: Palafoxia pedata, commonly known as the winged palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Palafoxia pedata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
